title: Prospects of Intellectual-Property Waiver on Covid-19 Vaccines Fade
sub_head: Agreement to waive IP looks increasingly unlikely, with U.S. not acting to bridge gap between supporters and opponents
body:
An agreement to waive the intellectual-property rights underpinning Covid-19 vaccines—a prospect poor countries have hoped would ease supplies to the developing world—is becoming increasingly unlikely, say people familiar with the situation, with the U.S. not acting to bridge disagreements between developing world countries and those opposing such a measure.
In May, the Biden administration said it would support temporarily suspending patents and other IP linked to the shots to allow developing countries to produce the Covid-19 vaccines created by big drug companies.
